title: Art Director (Shiseido)
description:
**Job Summary:**  

The Art Director will report to the Executive Creative Director on the assigned brands, and will be responsible for creating campaigns, print media (as needed), and digital content for all platforms.
  
  

**Primary Duties & Responsibilities:**  

Thorough understanding of the Digital World and able to provide clear vision on how to execute content across assigned Brands.
  
Photography and videography expertise (must be able to support a photoshoot).
  
Responsible for concept, shooting (video & stills), and executing content.
  
Participates in concepting campaigns for Brands.
  
Must be fluid in UX design on all digital platforms.
  
Works with Motion, VFX and Video Designers to enhance engagement value of digital projects.
  
Designs and sets up print layouts for visual merchandising and any other print projects.
  
Creates compelling website and landing page layouts for campaigns, product launches and promotions. Able to work closely with the ADX team to integrate innovative functionality to web designs.
  
Supports in E-commerce projects and teams as needed.
  
Understands business and industry.
  
Has the ability to translate needs into unique and compelling creative digital concepts based on the approved strategy & budgets.
  
Anticipate needs to identify solutions, future projects and increase the overall value of the Creative Team.
  
Participates in brands meetings.
  
Ensures all final work meets internal standards, and balance brand demands with participation in broader team initiatives.
  
Interdepartmental collaboration to see projects through to completion.
  
Fosters teamwork and a collaborative work environment. Inspires team morale and contributes to the overall Creative team culture.
  
  

**Working Relationships/Key Stakeholders:**  

Member of the Creative team works with Brands, Integrated Creative Services, and Production.
  
  

**Qualifications & Competencies:**  

5 years of Digital experience
  
Must be Brand-driven in all digital and print projects
  
Demonstrated Photography and art direction experience
  
Demonstrated ability to produce and drive results across all platforms
  
Knows how to use/execute all programs that are needed to create digital and print content
  
High taste level, and great aesthetic
  
  

Trust 8 Competencies
  
Below is a list of Trust 8 Competencies designed to help employees at Shiseido Americas succeed as the company continues to evolve and innovate.
  
**Think Big:** Adapt a big-picture perspective. Deliver new values through creativity.
  
**Take Risks:** Embrace Risk, Practice “Trial and Error and Trial”.
  
**Hands On:** Consider Front-line realities when making decisions. Take the lead from end to end.
  
**Collaborate:** Leverage the diverse capabilities of colleagues.
  
**Be Open:** Create an environment that encourages everyone to speak up.
  
**Act with Integrity:** Be sincere and humble at all times.
  
**Be Accountable:** Commit to the goal. Take accountability for the execution.
  
**Applaud Success:** Create a culture that celebrates success.

title: Manager, US Integrated Communications & Influencer Engagement
description:
Job Summary
  
This position is an integral part of the dynamic Shiseido US Integrated Communications team supporting all strategies, activations, communications programs, and initiatives. The Manager will support the Director, US Integrated Communications, in planning and executing all tactics supporting the brand’s communication plan. This role requires a strong knowledge of social media, PR, influencer marketing and events. The successful candidate can propose new ideas and create synergies across various media verticals. Having a pulse of the latest trends within the beauty/fashion/lifestyle space is critical. Diligent management of the budget, campaign priorities, and adherence to corporate guidelines will be an ongoing expectation.
  
  

Primary Duties & Responsibilities
  
Strategy
  
Support the brand communication strategy that promotes and protects our brand story, elevates our luxury positioning, and amplifies our brand awareness in the US. Track and measure performance against benchmarks and KPIs to enable consistent reporting on progress and success sharing with a focus on EMV, engagement, relevance and brand preference.
  
Influencer Relations
  
Monitor a wide network of talent, tastemakers, industry leaders and partners who embody the culture and values of Shiseido with a focus on skincare authorities, luxury brand partners, key opinion leaders/brand ambassadors.
  
Consistently manage influencer outreach list and identify opportunities to cultivate relationships with influencers that have an affinity toward the brand
  
Ideate and evaluate opportunities for partnerships to grow brand awareness and reach
  
Ideate around impactful influencer programming, collaborations and partnerships to support strategic launches including seeding
  
Explore opportunities for product integrations (film, TV, etc.) that will work to deliver positive transferable brand equity to Shiseido and increase cultural relevancy
  
Partner with paid media team to ideate around 360 launch strategies and influencer support (such as content creation optimized for paid media)
  
Monitor the team’s performance with mega, mid-tier and micro influencers to drive organic brand support and earned media value
  
Media Relations/Communications
  
Oversee Coordinator’s management of media and influencer lists, ensuring they are updated on a regular basis to confirm we are pitching and sending product to all key players in the industry
  
Oversee statements, cross-company coordination, crisis communications and development of materials for key interviews, meetings and event
  
Storytelling and Sustainability
  
Ideate and develop big ideas to support brand equity/DNA, Japanese heritage and drive forward US communications strategy to maximize earned media across all platforms
  
Manage relationship with brand’s charitable efforts (Skin Cancer Foundation Partnership) and build out communications plans and go to market strategies to support our key brand tenets
  
Activation and Management
  
Lead communication efforts for key launches and initiatives in close partnership with cross functional teams
  
Recap and present initiatives to US team and cross-functional partners with a keen focus on performance vs KPIs
  
Support team in planning all influencer and press events; oversee coordination of logistics including production, venue selection, catering, etc. with the support of external partners
  
Provide strong leadership and oversee the teams’ daily projects and responsibilities to elevate the team’s overall work
  
Support seeding strategies, product forecasts and inventory oversight for all new and existing product launches
  
Oversee and manage the implementation of the annual Ratings and Review program for all key launches and core products supporting Shiseido.com and retailers
  
  

Financial Accountability
  
Manages integrated communications budget throughout the year
  
Assist Finance with budget spend reporting and analysis to clearly track and report on budget vs actuals.
  
Review, track and submit invoices through approval process
  
Facilitate processing of invoices from key vendors on an ongoing basis
  
Drive contract negotiations with influencer managers
  
  

Qualifications & Competencies
  
Strong understanding and passion for the beauty and cosmetics industry
  
Bachelor of Arts degree preferably in Communications, English or Journalism.
  
4-6 years of experience in public relations/communications in agency or in-house, excluding internships. Experience in beauty PR preferred.
  
Extensive knowledge of the influencer and media landscape in the US
  
Strong relationships with influencers and editors (digital/print)
  
A strong sense of urgency, ability to manage details and projects while responding to changing priorities and feedback.
  
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, with sometimes short lead times, and pivot to address changing priorities.
  
Professional writing skills, including strategies, press releases, media alerts, talking points, and guidelines amongst others
  
Strong proficiency in budget management
  
Demonstrates a high level of maturity, resourcefulness, and poise in executive and corporate setting
  
Must work well with a large team in an open-office setting
  
Holds a strong work ethic and standard for which tasks and projects are completed (Attention to detail is a must)
  
Must be organized, creative, detail-oriented, able to prioritize multiple projects and possess an advanced understanding of industry trends, competition and innovation.
  
Skillful at building corporate allies, especially among key business partners, with a record of demonstrated ability to exercise excellent judgement consistently and build rapport quickly with both internal and external stakeholders of all levels
  
A values-based leader with a growth mindset, able to develop talent, led by example and motivate others
  
Knowledge of current trends, media industry news, entertainment/pop culture
  
Consumer focused decision maker with strong understanding of social/digital marketing
  
Ability to work independently and utilize sound judgment.
  
Software expertise – MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint
  
  

Trust 8 Competencies
  
Below is a list of Trust 8 Competencies designed to help employees at Shiseido Americas succeed as the company continues to evolve and innovate.
  
**Think Big:** Adapt a big-picture perspective. Deliver new values through creativity.
  
**Take Risks:** Embrace Risk, Practice “Trial and Error and Trial”.
  
**Hands On:** Consider Front-line realities when making decisions. Take the lead from end to end.
  
**Collaborate:** Leverage the diverse capabilities of colleagues.

title: Manager, New Product Development
description:
**Job Summary:**  

Responsible for leading the different project management for a line of Specialty Programs, Collections and Kits for a specific brand by developing and executing launch projects plans to deliver them OTIF. Collaborates with all cross-functional team members to ensure that all necessary learning, qualification, and execution activities of this type of project are completed in support of a successful launch. This individual is expected to manage a portfolio of projects, categorized as special programs or kits containing multiple WIPs which may vary between existing and new product development projects.
  
  

**Primary Duties & Responsibilities:**  

Lead product required changes from project brief generation to ATS (Available to Ship) ensuring timing, quantity, cost and KPI targets are achieved following a Stage Gate approach.
  
Develop and maintain project timelines throughout the entire development and executional cycle.
  
Lead all project meetings with internal and external (vendors and CM’s) cross functional partners and coordinate the seamless integration between Marketing, PD, R&D, Packaging and all Operational functions involved in developing product related projects.
  
Facilitate the costing process at different stages of the project throughout the launch cycle.
  
Consistently challenge and reduce development lead-times by ensuring. appropriate balanced risks are built into the original time plans, while ensuring all COGs, quality and service requirements are achieved/exceeded.
  
Elevate risks and bottlenecks encountered during the end to end life cycle of the entire NPD process with the respective mitigation plans.
  
  

**Working Relationships/Key Stakeholders:**  

**Brand:** Marketing, Product Development and Finance
  
**Operations:** Packaging Engineering, NPC (New Product Commercialization), S&OP, Distribution Center, Quality, Production/Fillers (Internal & External), Procurement & Finance
  
**R&D:** Formulation and Regulatory
  
  

**Qualifications & Competencies:**  

Work well with cross-functional teams and take a leadership role within the team.
  
Effective interpersonal skills are a must.
  
MS Project knowledge and experience required, Excel and Word
  
Minimum of 4 of project management experience in CPG or Beauty Industry
  
Understanding of new product development processes & stage gate approach.
  
Exposure to production environment & interaction of packaging, process, manufacturing.
  
Able to quickly analyze data and information from different places and put it together into a project plan or timeline.
  
  

Trust 8 Competencies

title: Luxury Manager~40 Hours + commission~Up to $70K
description:
**Now is the Time! Join our Team as a Luxury Manager!**

**Jared the Galleria of Jewelry is looking for YOU!**  
**Retail Reimagined.**...We are leading the industry and retail by meeting our customers where they are. Our **Path to Brilliance** is in full swing.

Our **Luxury Managers** are supporting their General and Assistant General Managers to deliver exceptional customer experience and sales results in store and virtually using our state of the art technology platforms and passion to succeed. It is the most exciting time to join **Jared** as we escalate our **Path to Brilliance** and lead the jewelry and retail industries as we **PIVOT** to excel our success forward.

Are you ready for a financially rewarding career you love where customer experience, team work and innovation will drive your success? Your passion combined with our state of the art technology and resources will launch your forever career.  
Apply to **Jared** if you are ready to **Pivot** to **Retail Reimagined**. 

**Luxury Manager:**  
Our Luxury Managers are helping us to redesign **Jared** while enjoying a 40hour work week and a financially rewarding career of celebrating life and expressing love with our customers. You will collaborate with the General and Assistant General Manager in developing exceptional teams, driving sales and profit excellence, and innovation to inspire your team to succeed in store and virtually.

We value **integrity**, **diversity**, **teamwork**, **innovation, agility and technical knowledge**. We offer **opportunities for advancement** and **financial rewards for success**. We provide training on coaching, in store and virtual sales techniques, technology, product knowledge and skills to take your career to the next level. In return, we ask that you bring your commitment to sales and profit excellence, desire to grow, agility and ability to deliver an exceptional customer and team member experience.

**Basic Function:**  
The Luxury Manager is a supporting management position within Jared. This position will achieve store and individual sales on all platforms by providing exceptional customer experience and expert product knowledge. This position will be responsible for overseeing merchandise launch executions, implementing product education provided by Signet, assists in training and developing the team in your area of expertise.  
**Responsibilities** include the following and will continue to evolve with our **Path to Brilliance**. Additional responsibilities will be discussed during your interview and upon hiring.

* Consistently attains sales results on all platforms while delivering an exceptional customer and team member experience.
* Build customer relationships through outreach and follow up using our clientele system and a variety of platforms and assists with training team members to do the same.
* Maintains our daily health and safety protocols including cleaning and sanitizing to ensure the safety of our customers and team.
* Completes all assigned training.
* Provides expert product knowledge training and implements visual merchandise displays according to company guidelines.
* Manages the team and store in the General Manager and Assistant General Manager’s absence. Supports and implements all policies.
* Collaborates with the General and Assistant General Manager on recruiting, hiring, scheduling, performance management and training of the team.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Required Skills and Abilities include:**

* Ability to lead by example by delivering sales and performance results daily and at Special Events.
* Positive, enthusiastic, team-spirited work style.
* Ability to innovate and collaborate within in a team environment.
* Ability to train and develop Team Members, conduct Store training meetings as needed.
* Professional approach and image.
* Tactful, friendly manner when dealing with people.
* Ability to plan, organize, follow-up and supervise the work of others.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including phone etiquette.
* Ability to accept responsibility, make decisions, delegate, and follow-up as appropriate.
* Reliable and dependable.

**A Sampling of Our Total Rewards:**  
\\*\\*  
Base pay plus commission on sales  
Benefits including medical, dental, vision and prescription insurance (full-time team members)  
401(k)  
Paid vacation  
Paid holidays (full-time team members)  
Tuition reimbursement, including DCA courses based on position  
Training   
Career development   
Merchandise discounts

title: Global Account Manager, Healthcare and Life Sciences - Pfizer
description:
* 7+ years of direct sales or business development in software, cloud or SaaS markets selling to C-level executives experience within Healthcare/Life Sciences
* 10+ years of business development, partner development, sales or alliances management experience in the technology space with cloud or software offerings


As a Global Accounts Manager for Healthcare Life Sciences, you will have the exciting opportunity to help drive the growth and shape the future of an emerging technology. Your responsibilities will include identifying great ways to improve outcomes for customers, driving revenue & adoption, and helping refine the AWS strategy within the HCLS vertical market segment, and building momentum with our largest HCLS accounts. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter who is prepared to own, define, develop and execute a business plan and consistently deliver on revenue targets while thinking strategically about long term customer outcomes.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Help identify key opportunities within global pharmaceutical customers that allow them to get more value AWS cloud solutions.
* Drive revenue and market share in assigned accounts.
* Meet or exceed revenue targets.
* Develop and execute a comprehensive regional plan.
* Accelerate customer adoption.
* Maintain a robust sales pipeline.
* Work with partners to extend reach & drive adoption
* Manage contract negotiations.
* Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts.
* Ensure customer satisfaction.
* Expect 30%+ travel (Travel within the US to visit customers, travel to Seattle (Amazon Headquarters) and occasional International Travel)


AWS values diverse experiences. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
  
  

Why AWS?
  
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
  
  

Inclusive Team Culture
  
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
  
  

Mentorship & Career Growth
  
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  
  

Work/Life Balance
  
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  
  

AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
  
  

The AWS Industries team is committed to helping industry customers enable their digital transformation journeys. Our primary goal is to meet customers where they are in their cloud journey and work backwards from their industry specific needs to transform their business and their entire industry. Our team speaks the language of our industry customers, which means that we focus on business outcomes and industry use cases on behalf of our customers, whether that is how we build products and solutions, how we sell, how we deliver, or how we partner.
  
  

* Experience developing detailed go to market plans
* Experience with AWS offerings


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.
  
  

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $128,600/year in our lowest geographic market up to $212,600/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. This position is eligible for variable pay via a sales compensation plan. These plans pay according to achievement level against sales targets and/or business objectives. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: Retail Account Manager
description:
Eaton’s ES AMER ARS division is currently seeking a Retail Account Manager to join the team. This is a remote role but must reside in one of the following states: Alabama, Arkansas, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Louisiana, Michigan, Minnesota, Mississippi, Missouri, Nebraska, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, West Virginia, or Wisconsin. This role will work with residential electrical products, wiring devices, and more. This is an exciting sales opportunity to collaborate within a positive team environment for a striving global organization. If you are a driver professional seeking a fast-pace, ever-changing business with lots of long-term customers, look no further and apply today!

**What you’ll do:**
-------------------


* You will be responsible for the preparation and achievement of annual sales budgets and forecasting agreed upon by the senior executive team.
* You will lead customer supply chain efforts to actualize customer and internal sales budget and triage potential shortcomings.
* You will produce weekly & quarterly reporting for both customer and internal teams to manage business, expose opportunities for improvement, and improve dialog with all stakeholders.
* You will manage merchandising projects related products resets, new product releases, and strategic efforts to drive a more productive business.
* You will facilitate develop and execute the retail Account’s strategic plan (playbook) throughout the sales and cross-functional teams that support the Account’s retail channel.
* You will be responsible for providing external intelligence and compiling competitive analysis (new product introductions, benchmarking, market share, SWOT analysis, pricing, etc).
* You will assist in the development of new product roadmaps (MGPP), pricing and marketing strategies – identifying gaps in the current product offerings, and lead the team to identify and implement innovative and differentiated solutions.
* You will have ongoing collaboration with supply chain and operations team to align sales/event forecast with production planning. Review key customer scorecards / metrics and facilitate improvement plans when needed.
* You will leverage the Product Management and Marketing teams to identify market trends and growth opportunities to drive customer behavior and profitability.
* You will proactively prepare strategic development and participation of key customer line reviews.
* You will foster relationships with the Merchants and their teams to proactively respond to their needs, identify new opportunities, resolve current issues and participate in Product Line Reviews, Promotions, Training, and other customer driven initiatives – striving to enable account satisfaction through superior customer service, account management and data management.
**Qualifications:**
-------------------


**Required (Basic) Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution.
* Minimum 4 years’ experience in sales, marketing, or merchandising roles working with consumer products
* Must be able to work in the United States without corporate sponsorship now and within the future.
* No relocation benefit is being offered for this position, candidate must reside in either Alabama, Arkansas, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Louisiana, Michigan, Minnesota, Mississippi, Missouri, Nebraska, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, West Virginia, or Wisconsin to be considered. Active Duty Military Service member candidates are exempt from the geographical area limitation
* Possess a valid driver’s license

  

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* 2+ years of Retail Account Management Experience
* 4+ years’ experience in sales, marketing, or merchandising roles working with consumer products, preferably in electrical products.
* Proficiency working with Microsoft Office Suite, strong analytical skills and high learning agility.
* 2+ years of Retail Marketing Experience
* 2+ years of Supply Chain or Logistics Experience

**Position Criteria:**

* **Willing to travel up to 50%**

The compensation range for this full-time position includes base pay and target sales performance incentive. This position has a target total compensation range of $138,750.00 - $203,500.00.

  

Base salaries are based upon candidate skills, experience, and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.

title: Foreperson Custodial Services
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Foreperson Custodial Services
  

**Job Category** URA-AFT Administrative
  

**Department** IPO-Envir. Services-New Bruns.
  

**Overview**
The Division of Institutional Planning & Operations (IP&O) employs a workforce of approximately 2,700 staff, represented by 15 collective negotiations agreements, and is responsible for institutional strategic initiatives and operations, which encompasses an expansive range of comprehensive service and business operations across the State of New Jersey. These include planning and construction, facilities, public safety and emergency operations, environmental health and safety, transportation, housing, and auxiliary/retail operations.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking a Foreperson Custodial Services for The Division of Institutional Planning & Operations (IP&O). This position is under the general supervision of the Operations Area Manager. The Foreperson of Custodial Services plans ,directs and coordinates all of the custodial responsibilities of a campus sector.
  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Interacts with Building Coordinators and vendors on a regular basis and during special events, sports events, concerts and graduation to ensure proper cleaning, set-ups and the satisfactory completion of all tasks.
* Hires, trains, and supervises custodial staff in the performance of their job responsibilities. Interprets university policies at the first line supervisory level.
* Responsible for conducting Step One grievances that arise in their work group.
* Responsible for coordinating, inspecting and accepting contract services in his/her area of responsibility.
* Maintains inventories, work orders, attendance and other required records accurately.
* Employee may be subject to mandatory overtime.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

  

**Position Status** Full Time
  

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift**
  

**Work Arrangement**
Consistent with the current application of Rutgers Policy 60.3.22 or the applicable provisions of relevant collective negotiations agreements, this position may be eligible for a hybrid work arrangement. Flexible work arrangements are not permanent, are subject to change or discontinuation, and contingent on the employee receiving approval in the FlexWork@RU Application System.
  

**FLSA** Nonexempt
  

**Grade** 03
  

**Position Salary**
  

**Annual Minimum Salary** 50065.000
  

**Annual Mid Range Salary** 62252.000
  

**Annual Maximum Salary** 74438.000
  

**Standard Hours** 40.00
  

**Union Description** URA-AFT Administrative
  

**Payroll Designation** PeopleSoft
  

**Benefits**
Rutgers offers a comprehensive benefit program to eligible employees. For details, please go to **http://uhr.rutgers.edu/benefits/benefits-overview**.  

  

**Seniority Unit**
  

**Terms of Appointment** Staff - 12 month
  

**Position Pension Eligibility** PERS
  

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* High school education; or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience.
* A minimum of two years of group leading or supervisory experience in custodial services.


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
* Valid driver’s license, two years driving experience, and successful completion of the Rutgers Defensive Driving course.


  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
* Must have good communication skills and computer literacy in Microsoft Office software and in industry related standard software.


  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Four years of group leading or supervisory experience in custodial services.
* Computer literacy including Word and Excel software and electronic time and attendance, and work order systems preferred.


  

**Equipment Utilized**
* Oversees and trains staff on cleaning equipment including rug shampoo and floor waxing machines, as well as the safe use of cleaning chemicals, etc.
* Will utilize computer equipment to obtain and update work orders and maintain time and attendance records.


  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
* May lift equipment and supplies weighing approximately 50 pounds.


  

**Special Conditions**
* Clean Driving Record


  

Posting Details
**Posting Number** 24ST1497
  

**Posting Open Date** 06/27/2024
  

**Special Instructions to Applicants**
  

**Regional Campus** Rutgers University-New Brunswick
  

**Home Location Campus** Busch (RU-New Brunswick)
  

**City** Piscataway
  

**State** NJ
  

**Location Details**
  

Pre-employment Screenings
All offers of employment are contingent upon successful completion of all pre-employment screenings.
Immunization Requirements
Under Policy 100.3.1 Immunization Policy for Covered Individuals, if employment will commence during Flu Season, Rutgers University may require certain prospective employees to provide proof that they are vaccinated against Seasonal Influenza for the current Flu Season, unless the University has granted the individual a medical or religious exemption. Additional infection control and safety policies may apply. Prospective employees should speak with their hiring manager to determine which policies apply to the role or position for which they are applying. Failure to provide proof of vaccination for any required vaccines or obtain a medical or religious exemption from the University will result in rescission of a candidate’s offer of employment or disciplinary action up to and including termination.

title: Nursing/Allied Health students for part time DSP role
description:
Unlock your potential with a fulfilling career as a Direct Support Professional (DSP), often listed among the Top 5 jobs for aspiring healthcare professionals. Picture this: meaningful work that aligns with your career goals is perfect for those post-clinical and class days!

Join our team here at Hamaspik of Rockland County, where our DSPs focus on providing respite for primary caregivers and imparting crucial life skills. 99% of our caseload has no hygienic work involved – your main role is creating a positive impact, teaching life skills, and gaining valuable experience.

Why settle for an ordinary job when you can contribute to something extraordinary? Whether it's the caring aspect, flexible hours, or resume boost, being a DSP opens doors to a future that resonates with your aspirations. Ready to make a difference? Let's talk! #HealthcareHeroes #CareerOpportunity #JoinUsNow

* Middletown

title: Pool Attendant
description:
Company: Aquatech Management

Experience: No experience or Certifications required; we provide training!

Job Duties:

· Take and record chemical readings

· Vacuum and clean pools

· Sign in guests if required

· Complete daily checklists in a timely manner and submit electronically

· Assist patrons with tasks such as opening umbrellas

Additional Benefits:

· Opportunity for year-round employment; indoor pools remain open throughout the year

· Work through Labor Day and receive a bonus

This position offers the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment where you can interact with guests of all ages while ensuring their safety and enjoyment. If you are enthusiastic, responsible, and enjoy working in a team-oriented setting, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join our pool attendant team!

To get a head start on the hiring process please visit our website at

www.aquatechmanagement - navigate to "Employment" - "Pool Attendant"
